definition: article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: A careful examination of the painting could tell whether it is an original or a copy.
sentences.chinese: 仔細研究一下這幅畫，就能看出它是贗品還是真跡。

sentences.english: The products on sale are fakes.
sentences.chinese: 市道市情上賣的那些外殼都是贗品。

sentences.english: You can tell that watch is a fake because the words carved on the back are misspelled.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看出這表是贗品，由於刻在背面的字拼錯了。

sentences.english: An expert was needed to authenticate the original van gogh painting from his imitation.
sentences.chinese: 這幅畫是梵谷的真跡還是贗品，需由專家來鑑定。

sentences.english: Here are seven of the most famous photoshop fakes.
sentences.chinese: 下面是七個最著名的PS贗品。

sentences.english: Adiscerning connoisseur would have found the vase a fake .
sentences.chinese: 一個識貨的鑑賞家本會發現這個古瓶是贗品。

sentences.english: But then this is the age of fakes.
sentences.chinese: 但是這注定了是一個贗品流行的時代。

sentences.english: I created it merely as a refrence in substitution for the real Gate.
sentences.chinese: 我僅僅是建造一個贗品來代替真正旳大門。

sentences.english: On closer examination the painting was proved to be a fake.
sentences.chinese: 再經仔細觀察證實那幅畫是贗品。

definition: tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
alternative name/to refer to sth by another name/antonomasia
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
red coral/precious coral (Corallium rubrum and several related species of marine coral)
variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
